remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided actuator is disconnected.

numlitem.para: Asymmetrical reverse thrust may be used. Use normal reversing procedures and techniques. If it appears that rudder authority is becoming limited during deceleration, return lever to reverse idle detent.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.
Downgrade aircraft dispatch category status to CAT 3a.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: Must be operative for dispatch into LPB, UIO, BOG, GUA,TGU.

placard.para: Placard affected Reverse Thrust Lever "REVERSER INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Check the position of the thrust lever interlock actuator and disconnect, if necessary.
Check that forward thrust lever is in idle position and the reverse thrust lever is fully forward.
Pull and collar applicable T/L INTERLOCK L (6J17) OR TL INTERLOCK R (6J23) circuit breaker on main power distribution panel P6.
Open forward equipment bay access door 113AL (Ref. 06-41-00).
Disconnect electrical connector from the affected thrust lever interlock actuator and install protective cover. Secure connector bundle end.
Measure the actuator length between actuator rod end and aft attachment clevis bolt axis. Retracted actuator length is approximately 11.25 inches.
If actuator is fully retracted, proceed to Step 2.
If actuator is extended, disconnect by removing bolts attaching actuator rod end to the autothrottle quadrant. Secure actuator rod to autothrottle drive assembly sideframe. Proceed to Step 2.
Deactivate the affected thrust reverser and lock in stowed (forward thrust) position using the procedures in Dispatch Maintenance Procedures 78-31-1-1.
